summary: Pre-built Rust bridge binaries are not being utilized on Windows during SDK installation, causing significantly longer installation times compared to Ubuntu and macOS.
userImpact: Windows users experience substantially longer SDK installation times due to compilation of Rust bridge instead of using pre-built binaries.
rootCause: Native Rust bridge binaries are not being properly detected or loaded on Windows platform during installation process.
resolutionDetails: Issue was resolved through fixes to the build system to properly handle pre-built Rust bridge binaries on Windows.
keyQuote: According to the build logs here it take a lot longer to install the SDK on Windows than Ubuntu / MacOS.
